intro: Androcymbium ciliolatum, commonly known as the featherleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, scale-like leaves with fine, ciliate margins, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
